title: Inside Britain’s ‘seduction bootcamps’ teaching men how to pick up women
text:
In a dark corner of YouTube, men share videos bragging about the number of women they have seduced, how they overcame 'last-minute resistance' – and audio of themselves apparently having sex. They are known as "pickup coaches", who make a living selling advice to other men about how to seduce women.

The so-called 'game' industry – as popularised in Neil Strauss's controversial 2005 book The Game – is worth an estimated £80 million globally, with a footprint in countries such as the UK, US, Australia, Canada and India.
